subject: Mental Health
title: Grief and Memory
description: Learn Grief and Memory in one minute.

hook.text: After a loss, some memories become painfully vivid while others vanish completely.

buildup.text: The hippocampus encodes emotional memories more strongly during periods of intense grief.

discovery.text: Grief fog â€” inability to concentrate or remember simple things â€” is caused by cortisol flooding the brain.

twist.text: Over time, painful memories soften as the brain reconsolidates them with less emotional charge.

climax.text: This natural memory processing is why eventually you can remember with love instead of only pain.

punchline.text: The brain rewrites memories so the love stays and the sharpness fades.
